summary: tweaks a few perks to make the bow a viable main weapon, while using the archery perk tree of Hunting in Skyrim
descriptionHtml:
[b]Description:[/b]
My favorite weapon is the bow, but in Skyrim it feels too weak, especially of you keep in mind that even a medieval longbow was capable of penetrating and killing a full armored knight. A bow, made of wood. Take that into Skyrim with materials much, much stronger than wood. And still you have to put multiple arrows in your enemies, even unarmored bandits.
There are a few mods here on the nexus, aiming at the same goal. But I like the mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18866/?]Hunting in Skyrim[/url], including the perks it comes along with (perk version, of course). So this mod aims for Hunting in Skyrim users, feeling the same way about bows like I do.

[b]In detail:[/b]
- Overdraw rank 4 and 5 give 25% armor penetration each -> 50% overall
- Quickdraw got a 2nd rank, increasing draw speed by a additional 20%
- Bullseye redesigned to "Dragon Hunter". Gives a 20% chance to do 2 times/ 5 times more damage to dragons

Some may ask: Why redesign Bullseye and not make a new perk? Mainly because the paralyse effect hits the moment the shot arrow [i]would[/i] hit it's target, resulting in the target stiffening up and falling out of the shot. Bullseye is a end perk and should feel awesome. Instead you get angry if it proccs and something like that happens. Besides I noticed: You are the Dragonborn. Killing dragons is what you do. And still, you don't have anything to fight against dragons in particular.

[b]Requirements:[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18866/?]Hunting in Skyrim[/url]

[b]Install:[/b]
Put the .esp in your data folder.

[b]Uninstall:[/b]
Remove the .esp from your data folder.

Disclaimer:
If anyone wants to mod my mod of a mod, feel free to message me. You may not alter my mod without my permission.

B1gBadDaddy for making [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18866/?]Hunting in Skyrim[/url]
Bethesda, cause.. well.. making Skyrim in the open minded way they did
